reactor.kafka.sender

Interface KafkaOutbound<K,V>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Publisher<java.lang.Void>

    public interface KafkaOutbound<K,V>
extends Publisher<java.lang.Void>
    KafkaOutbound is a reactive gateway for outgoing data flows to Kafka. Each KafkaOutbound represents a sequence of outgoing records that are sent to Kafka using send(Publisher). Send sequences may be chained together into a longer sequence of outgoing producer records. Like Flux and Mono, subscribing to the tail KafkaOutbound schedules all parent sends in the declaration order. Outgoing records of each topic partition will be delivered to Kafka in the declaration order.

    The subscriber to KafkaOutbound is notified of completion and failure of its send sequence. If any record cannot be delivered to Kafka, the outbound publisher fails with an error. Note that some of the subsequent records already in flight may still be delivered. If SenderOptions.stopOnError() is false, sends of all records will be attempted before the sequence is failed. No metadata is returned for individual records on success or failure. KafkaSender.send(Publisher) may be used to send records to Kafka when per-record completion status is required.

    Example usage: 

     
     kafkaSender.createOutbound()
       .send(flux1)
       .send(flux2)
       .send(flux3)
       .subscribe();

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      KafkaOutbound<K,V> send(Publisher<? extends ProducerRecord<K,V>> records)
      Sends a sequence of producer records to Kafka.
      KafkaOutbound<K,V> sendTransactionally(Publisher<? extends Publisher<? extends ProducerRecord<K,V>>> records)
      Sends records from each inner flux of records within a transaction.
      default void subscribe(Subscriber<? super java.lang.Void> subscriber)
      Subscribes the specified Void subscriber to this KafkaOutbound and triggers the send of pending producer record sequence queued using send(Publisher) to Kafka.
      Mono<java.lang.Void> then()
      Returns a Mono that completes when all the producer records in this outbound sequence sent using send(Publisher) are delivered to Kafka.
      KafkaOutbound<K,V> then(Publisher<java.lang.Void> other)
      Appends a Publisher task and returns a new KafkaOutbound to schedule further send sequences to Kafka after pending send sequences are complete.

    • Method Detail

      • send

        KafkaOutbound<K,V> send(Publisher<? extends ProducerRecord<K,V>> records)
        Sends a sequence of producer records to Kafka. No metadata is returned for individual producer records on success or failure. The send operation succeeds if all records are successfully delivered to Kafka based on the configured ack mode and fails if any of the records could not be delivered after the number of retries configured using ProducerConfig.RETRIES_CONFIG. SenderOptions.stopOnError() can be configured to stop the send sequence on first failure or to attempt sends of all records even if one or more records could not be delivered. The underlying Kafka sender may continue to be used until the sender is explicitly closed using KafkaSender.close().

        Sends may be chained by sending another record sequence on the returned KafkaOutbound.

        Example usage: 

         
     outbound.send(flux1)
             .send(flux2)
             .send(flux3)
             .subscribe();
        Parameters:
        records - Outbound producer records
        Returns:
        new instance of KafkaOutbound that may be used to control and monitor delivery of this send and to queue more sends to Kafka

      • sendTransactionally

        KafkaOutbound<K,V> sendTransactionally(Publisher<? extends Publisher<? extends ProducerRecord<K,V>>> records)
        Sends records from each inner flux of records within a transaction.

        Example usage: 

         
     outbound.sendTransactionally(outboundRecords1.window(10))
             .sendTransactionally(outboundRecords2.window(10))
             .then();

        When consuming and producing records within a single transaction, receiver offsets may be acknowledged as record is processed, so that all acknowledged offsets are committed in the transaction.If any of the publishers generates an error, the current transaction is aborted and the outbound chain is terminated.

        Example usage: 
         
 outbound.sendTransactionally(receiver.receiveExactlyOnce(sender)
                             .doOnNext(record -> record.receiverOffset().acknowledge())
                             .map(record -> toProducerRecord(destTopic, record))
                             .window(10));
        Parameters:
        records - Outbound producer records grouped as transactions. Records from each inner publisher are sent within a new transaction along with any receiver offsets acknowledged or committed by that publisher.
        Returns:
        new instance of KafkaOutbound that may be used to control and monitor delivery of this send and to queue more sends to Kafka

      • then

        KafkaOutbound<K,V> then(Publisher<java.lang.Void> other)
        Appends a Publisher task and returns a new KafkaOutbound to schedule further send sequences to Kafka after pending send sequences are complete.
        Parameters:
        other - the Publisher to subscribe to when this pending outbound then(org.reactivestreams.Publisher<java.lang.Void>) is complete
        Returns:
        new instance of KafkaOutbound that may be used to control and monitor delivery of pending sends and to queue more sends to Kafka

      • then

        Mono<java.lang.Void> then()
        Returns a Mono that completes when all the producer records in this outbound sequence sent using send(Publisher) are delivered to Kafka. The returned Mono fails with an error if any of the producer records in the sequence cannot be delivered to Kafka after the configured number of retries.
        Returns:
        Mono that completes when producer records from this KafkaOutbound are delivered to Kafka

      • subscribe

        default void subscribe(Subscriber<? super java.lang.Void> subscriber)
        Subscribes the specified Void subscriber to this KafkaOutbound and triggers the send of pending producer record sequence queued using send(Publisher) to Kafka.
        Specified by:
        subscribe in interface Publisher<java.lang.Void>
        Parameters:
        subscriber - the Subscriber to listen for send sequence completion or failure
